column1: Drug-induced hypoglycemia is low blood sugar that results from medication.
Low blood sugar is common in people with diabetes who are taking insulin or other medicines to control their diabetes.

All of the following can cause blood sugar (glucose) levels to drop: - Drinking alcohol - Getting too much activity - Intentionally or unintentionally overdosing on the medications used to treat diabetes - Missing meals Even when diabetes is managed very carefully, the medications used to treat diabetes can result in drug-induced hypoglycemia.
